Newborn babies are perfectly (i) _____________ , as yet unable to be concerned for others, or even to understand a difference between themselves and the world around them. As young children mature, they make the (ii) ______________ discovery that other people exist and have their own needs and desiresâ€” in other words, that the entire world is not about them. Blank (i) Blank (ii)
Blank (i)
Blank (ii)
A) solipsistic
D) arresting
B) sophomoric
E) selfish
C) quixotic
F) undue
